text.title: Root the HTC Inspire
text.head: Root the HTC Inspire
text.p: Rooting your HTC Inspire will allow you to remove preinstalled apps, free up memory, increase battery life, and generally improve the overall functionality of your device. The HTC Inspire can be rooted using the Easy Ace Root Tool program on any Windows-based computer.
text.head: Steps

list.item: Close any antivirus programs running on your Windows-based PC. Some antivirus programs can interfere with rooting, or recognize the East Ace Root Tool program as a type of malware.

Uninstall HTC Sync Manager from your computer, if applicable. The HTC Sync Manager may interfere with the rooting process when your HTC Inspire is connected to your computer.
Click on “Start” and select “Control Panel.” The Control Panel window will display on-screen.
Click on “Uninstall or change a program,” or “Add / Remove Programs,” depending on your version of Windows.
Click on “HTC Sync Manager,” then click on “Uninstall” or “Change / Remove.” Windows will uninstall HTC Sync Manager from your computer.

Back up all personal information you want saved on your HTC Inspire to another location. Rooting your HTC Inspire will wipe all personal data from the device.
Sync your personal data with Google's servers, copy files and folders to your computer, or use a third-party cloud storage app from Google Play Store to back up your data.
Navigate to the XDA Developers website at http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=2169518.
Scroll to the “Downloads” section in the first post and click on the link next to “EasyAceRootTool_21112013.” You will be redirected to the Dev Host file-sharing service website.
Select the option to download the Easy Ace Root Tool .zip file to your desktop. This file contains the rooting software needed for the HTC Inspire.
Right-click on the .zip file and select the option to extract the files.
Open the “tools” folder,” then open the “winddrivers” folder.
Double-click on the “HTC Drivers” .exe file. This file contains updated HTC Inspire drivers for your computer.
Follow the on-screen prompts to install the required drivers on your Windows PC.
Tap on Menu and select “Settings” on your HTC Inspire.
Place a checkmark next to “USB debugging.”
Connect the HTC Inspire to your computer using a USB cable.
Wait for the computer to recognize your device and install any necessary drivers.
Right-click on the file named “EasyAceRoot.cmd” and select “Run as administrator.”
Follow the on-screen prompts to finishing rooting your device. The Easy Ace Root Tool will guide you through the rooting process.
Wait for the Easy Ace Root Tool to inform you rooting is complete, then disconnect the HTC Inspire from your computer. Your device will now be rooted and ready for use.

text.head: Warnings

list.item: Rooting your HTC Inspire will void the manufacturer's warranty; however, you can follow these steps to unroot your Android device at any time to reinstate the warranty in the event you need to exchange or return your HTC Inspire under the warranty.
